commit.message:
Forgot to commit m88k changes.

From-SVN: r35070

files.patch:
@@ -5358,6 +5358,8 @@ for machine in $build $host $target; do
 		;;
 	m88k-*-openbsd*)
 		tmake_file="${tmake_file} m88k/t-luna-gas"
+		tm_file="m88k/aout-dbx.h aoutos.h m88k/m88k.h openbsd.h ${tm_file}"
+		xm_file="xm-openbsd.h m88k/xm-m88k.h ${xm_file}"
 		;;
 	m88k-*-sysv3*)
 		tm_file=m88k/sysv3.h
@@ -6941,15 +6943,15 @@ fi
 
 
         echo $ac_n "checking for strerror in -lcposix""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6945: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
+echo "configure:6947: checking for strerror in -lcposix" >&5
 ac_lib_var=`echo cposix'_'strerror | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   ac_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
 LIBS="-lcposix  $LIBS"
 cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6953 "configure"
+#line 6955 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
 /* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
@@ -6960,7 +6962,7 @@ int main() {
 strerror()
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:6964: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:6966: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_lib_$ac_lib_var=yes"
 else
@@ -6983,12 +6985,12 @@ fi
   
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working const""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:6987: checking for working const" >&5
+echo "configure:6989: checking for working const" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 6992 "configure"
+#line 6994 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 int main() {
@@ -7037,7 +7039,7 @@ ccp = (char const *const *) p;
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7041: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7043: \"$ac_compile\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_compile) 2>&5; }; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_c_const=yes
 else
@@ -7058,12 +7060,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for off_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7062: checking for off_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7064: checking for off_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_off_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7067 "configure"
+#line 7069 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7091,12 +7093,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for size_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7095: checking for size_t" >&5
+echo "configure:7097: checking for size_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_size_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7100 "configure"
+#line 7102 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -7126,19 +7128,19 @@ fi
 # The Ultrix 4.2 mips builtin alloca declared by alloca.h only works
 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7130: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
+echo "configure:7132: checking for working alloca.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_alloca_h'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7135 "configure"
+#line 7137 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <alloca.h>
 int main() {
 char *p = alloca(2 * sizeof(int));
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7142: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7144: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_header_alloca_h=yes
 else
@@ -7159,12 +7161,12 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for alloca""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7163: checking for alloca" >&5

   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7168 "configure"

 #include "confdefs.h"
 
 #ifdef __GNUC__
@@ -7192,7 +7194,7 @@ int main() {

 ; return 0; }

+if { (eval echo configure:7198: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   ac_cv_func_alloca_works=yes
 else
@@ -7224,12 +7226,12 @@ EOF
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7228: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5
+echo "configure:7230: checking whether alloca needs Cray hooks" >&5

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7233 "configure"
+#line 7235 "configure"

 webecray
@@ -7254,12 +7256,12 @@ echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_os_cray" 1>&6
 if test $ac_cv_os_cray = yes; then
 for ac_func in _getb67 GETB67 getb67; do
   echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:7258: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:7260: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:7286: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:7288: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"
 else
@@ -7309,15 +7311,15 @@ done
 fi

-echo "configure:7313: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
+echo "configure:7315: checking stack direction for C alloca" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_stack_direction'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=0

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 7321 "configure"
+#line 7323 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"

 {
@@ -7336,7 +7338,7 @@ main ()

+if { (eval echo configure:7342: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_c_stack_direction=1
 else
@@ -7363,17 +7365,17 @@ unistd.h sys/param.h

 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6

 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
